name: data-analytics-bootcamp
title: Data Analytics Bootcamp
summary: Intensive 11-week full-time bootcamp focused on data analysis, visualization, and machine learning techniques using Python, SQL, and other data science tools.
details: Comprehensive training in Python programming for data analysis using Pandas and NumPy
Advanced data visualization techniques with Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly, and Tableau for creating interactive dashboards
Statistical analysis and hypothesis testing methodologies for data-driven decision making
Machine learning fundamentals including supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms
SQL database management and complex query optimization for data extraction and manipulation
Real-world project experience analyzing datasets from various industries and presenting actionable insights
Version control with Git and collaborative development practices for data science projects

name: fullstack-web-development-bootcamp
title: Full-Stack Web Development Bootcamp
summary: Intensive 9-week full-time bootcamp covering modern web development technologies to build full-stack applications using the MERN stack.
details: Comprehensive training in HTML5, CSS3, and responsive design using vanilla JavaScript and Mantine UI for modern web interfaces
JavaScript mastery including ES6 features, DOM manipulation, and Canvas for graphics and animations
Backend development with Node.js and Express.js for building RESTful APIs and server-side applications
MongoDB database management with Mongoose ODM for data persistence and complex queries
Authentication systems implementation using Passport.js and secure user management practices
Advanced frontend development with React.js including components, state management, and single-page applications
Full-stack MERN development integrating frontend and backend for complete web applications
Three hands-on projects: JavaScript game using Canvas, full-stack Express application, and final MERN stack project
Version control with Git and GitHub for collaborative development and deployment on Heroku
Learn-by-doing methodology with pair programming, real-world collaboration, and presentation skills

name: architecture-degree
title: Bachelor of Architecture
summary: Comprehensive 6-year professional degree in Architecture from Universidad de Buenos Aires, covering design methodology, construction technology, urban planning, structural systems, and professional practice with extensive legal and technical competencies.
details: Architectural design methodology through progressive studio courses (Architecture I-IV) focusing on spatial problem-solving and human habitat design
Construction technology and building systems including structural design, MEP installations, and material science across multiple specialized courses
Project management and construction administration including work direction, legislation, budgeting, and contractor coordination
Legal framework and professional practice including building codes, zoning regulations, construction law, and professional liability (Work Direction and Legislation)
MEP systems design through specialized installation courses covering HVAC, electrical, plumbing, and fire safety integration
Structural engineering fundamentals with progressive complexity from basic structural types to advanced structural design and calculation
Urban planning and territorial organization including physical-environmental planning and urban space occupation strategies
Building information modeling and technical representation using CAD systems for precise documentation and project coordination
Architectural history and theory providing cultural context from contemporary architecture through historical analysis
Professional competencies including real estate appraisal, expert witness services, arbitration, and property valuation
Environmental design and sustainability principles including passive design strategies and energy efficiency
Construction safety and hygiene protocols for architectural works and construction site management
Research methodologies for architectural and urban planning problems and space organization studies
company: Universidad de Buenos Aires (UBA) - Facultad de Arquitectura, Dise√±o y Urbanismo
